data.title: Tender Pork Steak
data.text: The pork steak is very tender, ribs fall off the bone, and good sides. Fair prices and good food make this a great value

data.title: Good family owned bar-b-q
data.text: Piggy's is a locally owned place that serves very good bar-b-q. The menu is fairly small; pulled pork, ribs, pulled chicken, brisket, and brats, served as a plate or a sandwich. The bar-b-q is very good but the sides are only average. The prices at Piggy's are lower than you will generally find for bar-b-q. The dining area has five tables. On our most recent visit it took quite a while for our food to arrive even though it was a Monday night and not busy. Overall, good inexpensive local bar-b-q.

data.title: Best Beef Brisket around
data.text: Always get take out but the beef is the best every, they've won lots of local awards for barbecue but I'm not a big pulled pork person (my family loves their pulled pork) but the beef is SO good.  Just a diner like place, take it home and enjoy.  Sides are excellent and they have their own barbecue sauces they sell, rubs, all that, for every taste.  Super good.

data.title: Decent Pork
data.text: I had a sampler of various meats, which was good. I would stop by here to grab some ribs for a good meal, but the others seemed a bit rewarmed. It possibly could have been that it was between 7-8pm, but the ribs were by far the best thing I had from there.
